etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin resonantia ‘echo’, from resonare ‘resound’ (see resonant)

definitions: the quality in a sound of being deep, full, and reverberating
shortDefinitions: quality in sound of being deep and reverberating

definitions: the ability to evoke or suggest images, memories, and emotions

examples.text: the concepts lose their emotional resonance

shortDefinitions: power to evoke enduring images and emotions

definitions: the reinforcement or prolongation of sound by reflection from a surface or by the synchronous vibration of a neighboring object.
shortDefinitions: reinforcement or prolongation of sound by reflection from surface or by synchronous vibration of neighbouring object

definitions: the condition in which an electric circuit or device produces the largest possible response to an applied oscillating signal, especially when its inductive and its capacitative reactances are balanced.
shortDefinitions: condition in which electric circuit or device produces largest possible response to applied oscillating signal

definitions: the condition in which an object or system is subjected to an oscillating force having a frequency close to its own natural frequency.
shortDefinitions: condition in which object or system is subjected to oscillating force having frequency close

definitions: the occurrence of a simple ratio between the periods of revolution of two bodies about a single primary.
shortDefinitions: occurrence of simple ratio between periods of revolution of two bodies about single primary

definitions: the state attributed to certain molecules of having a structure that cannot adequately be represented by a single structural formula but is a composite of two or more structures of higher energy.
shortDefinitions: state of having molecular structure which cannot adequately be represented by single structural formula but is composite of two

definitions: a short-lived subatomic particle that is an excited state of a more stable particle.
shortDefinitions: short-lived subatomic particle that is excited state of more stable particle
